title: Ionic Native Community
body: Ionic Native Community is a collection of TypeScript wrappers for open source Cordova and Capacitor plugins that make it easy to add native functionality to any Ionic app.
These Community Plugins are submitted and maintained by the Ionic community. While community members are generally quick to find and fix issues, certain plugins may not function properly.
For teams that require dedicated native plugin support & SLAs, ongoing maintenance, and security patches, please explore
These docs are for apps built with Ionic Framework 4.0.0 and greater. For older Ionic v3 projects, please
In addition to Cordova, Ionic Native also works with
, Ionic's official native runtime. Basic usage below. For complete details,

All plugins have two components - the native code (Cordova) and the TypeScript code (Ionic Native).
Cordova plugins are also wrapped in a
in order to provide a common plugin interface and modernized development approach.
as an example, first install it:

cordova-plugin-camera

// Install Ionic Native TypeScript wrapper
Next, begin using the plugin, following the various framework usage options below. For FAQ, see
Angular apps can use either Cordova or Capacitor to build native mobile apps. Import the plugin in a
and add it to the list of Providers. For Angular, the import path should end with
.  Angular's change detection is automatically handled.
After the plugin has been declared, it can be imported and injected like any other service:
// Do something with the new photo
React apps must use Capacitor to build native mobile apps. However, Ionic Native (and therefore, Cordova plugins) can still be used.
// Update native platform project(s) to include newly added plugin
Import the plugin object then use its static methods:

Vanilla JavaScript apps, targeting ES2015+ and/or TypeScript, can use either Cordova or Capacitor to build native mobile apps. To use any plugin, import the class from the appropriate package and use its static methods:
